column4: Definition of indicator in plain language
Year that the indicator was reported

column6: PL;Place; CO;County; RE; Region; R4; Consolidated Statistical Metropolitan Area; CA;State
FIPS ID; place code, CT code, zip code, region id.  The geotypevalues 99999 for PL and 99999999999 for CT indicate injury data that did not geocode.

column4: Name of county that geotype is in
FIPS code of county that geotype is in
column6: 2-digit census state code (06) plus 3-digit census county code

column4: MPO-based region name; see MPO_County list tab
MPO-based region code; see MPO_County list tab
column6: 01=Bay Area; 02=Butte; 03=Central/Southeast Sierra; 04=Monterey Bay; 05=North Coast; 06=Northeast Sierra; 07=Northern Sacramento Valley; 08=Sacramento Area; 09=San Diego; 10=San Joaquin Valley; 11=San Luis Obispo; 12=Santa Barbara; 13=Shasta; 14=Southern California

column4: Mode of transportation of the victim
column6: Bicyclist, Bus, Car/Pickup, Motorcycle, Pedestrian, Truck, Vehicles, All modes, ND=no data

column4: Denominator 1, total population in the geographic area
Rate of injuries over total population (injuries per 100,000 people)
column6: Available for  the geotypes CA, RE, PL, CO, and CT (2006-2010 only), for all  modes of transporation of the victim (Vehicles, Car/Pickup, Bus, Truck, Motorcycle, Bicyclist, and Pedestrian For the geotype R4, only Bicycle and Walk data are available. See Guide2Numerator-Denominator worksheet.

column4: Relative standard error (se/value) expressed as a percent
California decile for poprate, available for cities/towns (geotype=PL), year 2006-2010.  Deciles are for each mode by severity combination
column6: CA_decile' groups California places into 10 groups (or deciles) each, for total population. Equal values or 'ties' are assigned the mean decile rank. For example, in a database of 100 records where 70 records equal 0, 0 values span from the 1st to 7th deciles (70% of all data records).

column4: Ratio of poprate in geographic area to state average
Denominator 2, annual vehicle miles traveled in the geographic area.  In the case of bicycles and pedestrians, this variable indicates the miles traveled by biking and walking
Rate of injuries over annual miles traveled (injuries per 109 miles traveled)
column6: Available for the geotypes CA, CO, RE, and PL, for Vehicles mode only.  Bicyclist and Pedestrian data is available for the geotypes R4 and CA.  See Guide2Numerator-Denominator worksheet.

column4: Relative standard error (se/value) expressed as a percent
California decile for avmtrate, available for cities/towns (geotype=PL), year 2006-2010. Deciles are for each mode by severity combination
column6: CA_decile' groups California places into 10 groups (or deciles) each, for total population. Equal values or 'ties' are assigned the mean decile rank. For example, in a database of 100 records where 70 records equal 0, 0 values span from the 1st to 7th deciles (70% of all data records).

column4: Ratio of avmtrate in geographic area to state average
Total population in group quarters in the geographic area
Date/time stamp of version of data
